alert.note: Alert for Northeast Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 3:42PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Weld County through 430 PM MDT... At 340 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northeast of Hereford to 4 miles east of Grover, or along a line extending from 30 miles east of Cheyenne to 45 miles northeast of Greeley. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could produce blowing dust, reduced visibility, and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grover. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
